page.title: 05 THE TELEPHONE EXCHANGE
page.content: Before the telephone exchange was built all calls had to go through the operator in what is now the Greffe office.Often the person called would be at home but because the Island is small the operator would know where to find them and would divert the call to the pub,hotel or whereverthe recipient was at the time. Now calls go through the exchange automatically. Inside the exchange ther are six rooms.The biggest room is the one where calls are received.Another room houses a generator so that if there is a power cut the generator in the exchange would start up.If that to fails,then twenty-four batteries will keep the exchange going for up to a day.There is also a 500ft high mast outside.The telephone engineer now has his own tractor for service calls.
